Base Types
Object
Implicit Singletons
Global, ObjectManager, Math, DegreesManager, RadiansManager, RandomNumberGenerator, BitwiseOperations


Overview

Implements methods for Radians compound values, allowing them to be used with standard arithmetic operators.


Methods

create_from( Degrees deg ).Radians

Creates a Radians value of the same angle as deg.


op%( Radians rad, Real64 factor ).Radians

Returns rad mod factor.


op%( Real64 factor, Radians rad ).Radians

Returns rad mod factor.


op*( Radians rad, Real64 factor ).Radians

Returns rad scaled by factor.


op*( Real64 factor, Radians rad ).Radians

Returns rad scaled by factor.


op+( Radians rad, Degrees deg ).Radians

Returns the sum of two angles. Called automatically when there's an expression of the form "a1 + a2".


op+( Radians rad1, Radians rad2 ).Radians

Returns the sum of two angles. Called automatically when there's an expression of the form "a1 + a2".


op-( Radians rad1 ).Radians

Returns the negative of the given angle. Called automatically when there's an expression of the form "-a".


op-( Radians rad, Degrees deg ).Radians

Returns the difference of two angles. Called automatically when there's an expression of the form "a1 - a2".


op-( Radians rad1, Radians rad2 ).Radians

Returns the difference of two angles. Called automatically when there's an expression of the form "a1 - a2".


op/( Radians rad, Real64 factor ).Radians

Returns rad scaled by factor.


op/( Real64 factor, Radians rad ).Radians

Returns rad scaled by factor.


to_Degrees( Radians rad ).Degrees

Converts the given value from radians into degrees.


to_String().String (inherited)

Returns a String representation of this object. Most classes should override this method to summarize an object's state for convenience in testing and debugging.


to_String( Radians rad ).String

Returns the value in radians as a string.


type_name().String (inherited)

Returns the true class name of this object. Implemented by the runtime; you should not override this method. Equivalent to calling "runtime_type.name" in the introspection library.

Example: 

 local Object obj = "Hello World"
 println( obj.type_name ) # prints: String

See also:

  • RuntimeType
